intro: Stibadotheca, commonly known as the "scented shield fern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Stibadotheca is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a unique and ornamental addition to botanical gardens.
